extra.message: Affected versions of rexml are vulnerable to Improper Restriction of Recursive Entity References in DTDs ('XML Entity Expansion'). This can lead to DoS vulnerability when it parses an XML that has many deep elements that have same local name attributes. This does not affect other parser APIs such as stream parser API and SAX2 parser API.

cwe: CWE-776: Improper Restriction of Recursive Entity References in DTDs ('XML Entity Expansion')

extra.message: Detected controller which does not enable cross-site request forgery protections using 'protect_from_forgery'. Add 'protect_from_forgery :with => :exception' to your controller class.

cwe: CWE-352: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
metadata.license: Semgrep Rules License v1.0. For more details, visit semgrep.dev/legal/rules-license

extra.lines:
class ApplicationController < ActionController::Base
  include Pundit::Authorization

  after_action :verify_pundit_authorization, unless: :active_admin_controller?

  def active_admin_controller?
    is_a?(ActiveAdmin::BaseController) || is_a?(ActiveAdmin::Devise::Controller)
  end

  def verify_pundit_authorization
    if action_name == "index"
      verify_policy_scoped
    else
      verify_authorized

extra.message: Detected a unquoted template variable as an attribute. If unquoted, a malicious actor could inject custom JavaScript handlers. To fix this, add quotes around the template expression, like this: "<%= expr %>".

extra.message: Affected versions of path-to-regexp are vulnerable to Inefficient Regular Expression Complexity. A bad regular expression is generated any time you have two parameters within a single segment, separated by something that is not a period (.). For example, `/:a-:b`. This can be mitigated by providing a custom regular expression for parameters after the first in a single segment (for example, changing `/:a-:b` to `/:a-:b([^-/]+)`).

cwe: CWE-1333: Inefficient Regular Expression Complexity
metadata.license: Semgrep Rules License v1.0. For more details, visit semgrep.dev/legal/rules-license
